The concentration of water does not change during the reaction - it remains at a constant value of 55.5. So we include it in the calculation of the pKa value. To see what I mean by that, check out this lecture here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVC6tykua6A .. I talk about it at the bottom left correct! Hope that helps and good luck on your presentation!

its a logarithmic function that is used all throughout math. its on your calculator, if thats what you mean.
:/ but what is it ? I'm not using a calculator.
That would probably require an entire lecture to explain what the log function is and how its used. You've never used this function before ?

In high school 10+ years ago. It doesn't matter, I'll data dump it after this class if I did try to relearn it. If I need it for my final or midterm, I'll count them as a loss. There's not a real need to have this cemented in my brain for clinical purposes. Thanks though.

lol I see. The short answer to your question is that the log function is basically a function that allows you to determine what the exponent term is in a certain equation where the exponent is the unknown. For example 100 = 10^x, you can use the log function to determine what x is quite easily.. Of course I gave you an easy example that you can probably do in your head. But if the equation read 12,300 = 4^x, now you'd be stumped. But if you used the log function, it would give you a quick way to solve for that. So the purpose of the log is to solve for exponents.
there are also a bunch of rules that exist when working with log functions (called the laws of logs). You usually need to know them to use logs in any effective way.
Awesome dude thanks!!
